verses.verse: She is more precious than jewels, and nothing you desire can compare with her.
Charm is deceitful, and beauty is vain, but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised.
And now, my daughter, do not fear. I will do for you all that you ask, for all my fellow townsmen know that you are a worthy woman.
For wisdom is better than jewels, and all that you may desire cannot compare with her.
An excellent wife who can find? She is far more precious than jewels.
House and wealth are inherited from fathers, but a prudent wife is from the Lord.
She opens her hand to the poor and reaches out her hands to the needy.
His divine power has granted to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him who called us to his own glory and excellence,
She perceives that her merchandise is profitable. Her lamp does not go out at night.
The heart of her husband trusts in her, and he will have no lack of gain.
There is gold and abundance of costly stones, but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
She makes bed coverings for herself; her clothing is fine linen and purple.
He who finds a wife finds a good thing and obtains favor from the Lord.
Behold, children are a heritage from the Lord, the fruit of the womb a reward.
And though your beginning was small, your latter days will be very great.
She opens her mouth with wisdom, and the teaching of kindness is on her tongue.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding.
But I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh.
Husbands, love your wives, as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her,
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and hold fast to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.
The wisest of women builds her house, but folly with her own hands tears it down.
Strength and dignity are her clothing, and she laughs at the time to come.
But let your adorning be the hidden person of the heart with the imperishable beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which in God's sight is very precious.
He must increase, but I must decrease.”
Flee from sexual immorality. Every other sin a person commits is outside the body, but the sexually immoral person sins against his own body.
And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.
Their wives likewise must be dignified, not slanderers, but sober-minded, faithful in all things.
“For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, to gratify its desires.
And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ.
For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,
She dresses herself with strength and makes her arms strong.
I know how to be brought low, and I know how to abound. In any and every circumstance, I have learned the secret of facing plenty and hunger, abundance and need.
Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me. Cast me not away from your presence, and take not your Holy Spirit from me.
Seek the Lord and his strength; seek his presence continually!
She opens her hand to the poor and reaches out her hands to the needy. She is not afraid of snow for her household, for all her household are clothed in scarlet.
For you formed my inward parts; you knitted me together in my mother's womb.
And blessed is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of what was spoken to her from the Lord.”
Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering, for he who promised is faithful.
For what we proclaim is not ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, with ourselves as your servants for Jesus' sake.
And whatever you ask in prayer, you will receive, if you have faith.”
And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
So faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ.
Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast.
For we walk by faith, not by sight.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.
For nothing will be impossible with God.”
You believe that God is one; you do well. Even the demons believe—and shudder!
So that your faith might not rest in the wisdom of men but in the power of God.
For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God,
I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
And Jesus said to him, “‘If you can’! All things are possible for one who believes.”
The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith!”
You see that a person is justified by works and not by faith alone.
I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.
Be watchful, stand firm in the faith, act like men, be strong.
For everyone who has been born of God overcomes the world. And this is the victory that has overcome the world—our faith.
And Jesus said to him, “Go your way; your faith has made you well.” And immediately he recovered his sight and followed him on the way.
For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith for faith, as it is written, “The righteous shall live by faith.”
May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that by the power of the Holy Spirit you may abound in hope.
“Be still, and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth!”
Because, if you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
So now faith, hope, and love abide, these three; but the greatest of these is love.
But let him ask in faith, with no doubting, for the one who doubts is like a wave of the sea that is driven and tossed by the wind.
In all circumstances take up the shield of faith, with which you can extinguish all the flaming darts of the evil one;
Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst.
For you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness.
So also faith by itself, if it does not have works, is dead.
I told you that you would die in your sins, for unless you believe that I am he you will die in your sins.”
“Behold, his soul is puffed up; it is not upright within him, but the righteous shall live by his faith.
Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life; whoever does not obey the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.
Whoever believes in me, as the Scripture has said, ‘Out of his heart will flow rivers of living water.’”
And if I have prophetic powers, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.
Fight the good fight of the faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called and about which you made the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
As for the one who is weak in faith, welcome him, but not to quarrel over opinions.
Then Jesus answered her, “O woman, great is your faith! Be it done for you as you desire.” And her daughter was healed instantly.
By faith Sarah herself received power to conceive, even when she was past the age, since she considered him faithful who had promised.
But he said, “What is impossible with man is possible with God.”
Jesus said to her, “Did I not tell you that if you believed you would see the glory of God?”
But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God,
But as for you, O man of God, flee these things. Pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, steadfastness, gentleness.
And Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
For with the heart one believes and is justified, and with the mouth one confesses and is saved.
Therefore, since we have been justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.”
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
So we are always of good courage. We know that while we are at home in the body we are away from the Lord, for we walk by faith, not by sight.
For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
Remembering before our God and Father your work of faith and labor of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.
Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ has been born of God, and everyone who loves the Father loves whoever has been born of him.
But my righteous one shall live by faith, and if he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.”
“No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.
Immediately the father of the child cried out and said, “I believe; help my unbelief!”
And the Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.
For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision counts for anything, but only faith working through love.
Jesus turned, and seeing her he said, “Take heart, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And instantly the woman was made well.
But whoever has doubts is condemned if he eats, because the eating is not from faith. For whatever does not proceed from faith is sin.
Casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.
But someone will say, “You have faith and I have works.” Show me your faith apart from your works, and I will show you my faith by my works.
Let no one despise you for your youth, but set the believers an example in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
And he said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
Truly, truly, I say to you, whoever believes has eternal life.
Who is it that overcomes the world except the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
But they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.
I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life.
For by it the people of old received their commendation.
I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I set your rules before me.
Be strong and courageous. Do not fear or be in dread of them, for it is the Lord your God who goes with you. He will not leave you or forsake you.”
Let all that you do be done in love.
Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins.
And above all these put on love, which binds everything together in perfect harmony.
Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.
We love because he first loved us.
Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all offenses.
There is no fear in love, but perfect love casts out fear. For fear has to do with punishment, and whoever fears has not been perfected in love.
Beloved, let us love one another, for love is from God, and whoever loves has been born of God and knows God.
But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
With all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love,
“If you love me, you will keep my commandments.
A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
Owe no one anything, except to love each other, for the one who loves another has fulfilled the law.
So we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.
Let love be genuine. Abhor what is evil; hold fast to what is good.
Love one another with brotherly affection. Outdo one another in showing honor.
Love does no wrong to a neighbor; therefore love is the fulfilling of the law.
Little children, let us not love in word or talk but in deed and in truth.
Beloved, let us love one another, for love is from God, and whoever loves has been born of God and knows God. Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
“This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.
However, let each one of you love his wife as himself, and let the wife see that she respects her husband.
The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
Whoever covers an offense seeks love, but he who repeats a matter separates close friends.
With all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love, eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
If anyone says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother whom he has seen cannot love God whom he has not seen.
Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God so that at the proper time he may exalt you, casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.
But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.
No one has ever seen God; if we love one another, God abides in us and his love is perfected in us.
A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another: just as I have loved you, you also are to love one another.
Whoever has my commandments and keeps them, he it is who loves me. And he who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and manifest myself to him.”
By this we know love, that he laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.
Many waters cannot quench love, neither can floods drown it. If a man offered for love all the wealth of his house, he would be utterly despised.
And hope does not put us to shame, because God's love has been poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who has been given to us.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.
The Lord appeared to him from far away. I have loved you with an everlasting love; therefore I have continued my faithfulness to you.
Because your steadfast love is better than life, my lips will praise you.
Having purified your souls by your obedience to the truth for a sincere brotherly love, love one another earnestly from a pure heart,
Jesus answered him, “If anyone loves me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.
And this commandment we have from him: whoever loves God must also love his brother.
Beloved, if God so loved us, we also ought to love one another.
And he said to him, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.
Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword?
Let me hear in the morning of your steadfast love, for in you I trust. Make me know the way I should go, for to you I lift up my soul.
Love is patient and kind; love does not envy or boast; it is not arrogant or rude. It does not insist on its own way; it is not irritable or resentful;
You shall not take vengeance or bear a grudge against the sons of your own people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the Lord.
For you were called to freedom, brothers. Only do not use your freedom as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another.
Because you are precious in my eyes, and honored, and I love you, I give men in return for you, peoples in exchange for your life.
Love is patient and kind; love does not envy or boast; it is not arrogant
So Jacob served seven years for Rachel, and they seemed to him but a few days because of the love he had for her.
Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
If I speak in the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am a noisy gong or a clanging cymbal.
“This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you. Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.
Complete my joy by being of the same mind, having the same love, being in full accord and of one mind.
I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently find me.
For the love of Christ controls us, because we have concluded this: that one has died for all, therefore all have died;
How beautiful is your love, my sister, my bride! How much better is your love than wine, and the fragrance of your oils than any spice!
Better is a dinner of herbs where love is than a fattened ox and hatred with it.
My beloved is mine, and I am his; he grazes among the lilies.
Let love be genuine. Abhor what is evil; hold fast to what is good. Love one another with brotherly affection. Outdo one another in showing honor.
If you really fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you are doing well.
A lovely deer, a graceful doe. Let her breasts fill you at all times with delight; be intoxicated always in her love.
Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth! For your love is better than wine;
And walk in love, as Christ loved us and gave himself up for us, a fragrant offering and sacrifice to God.
“You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’ But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
I have said these things to you, that in me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But take heart; I have overcome the world.”
Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in every way. The Lord be with you all.
You keep him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on you, because he trusts in you.
“Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God.
Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your hearts be troubled, neither let them be afraid.
Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God.
If possible, so far as it depends on you, live peaceably with all.
And let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, to which indeed you were called in one body. And be thankful.
In peace I will both lie down and sleep; for you alone, O Lord, make me dwell in safety.
Strive for peace with everyone, and for the holiness without which no one will see the Lord.
For to set the mind on the flesh is death, but to set the mind on the Spirit is life and peace.
Great peace have those who love your law; nothing can make them stumble.
And a harvest of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.
Let him turn away from evil and do good; let him seek peace and pursue it.
Turn away from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it.
For God is not a God of confusion but of peace. As in all the churches of the saints,
May the Lord give strength to his people! May the Lord bless his people with peace!
And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
When a man's ways please the Lord, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil, but those who plan peace have joy.
What you have learned and received and heard and seen in me—practice these things, and the God of peace will be with you.
Finally, brothers, rejoice. Aim for restoration, comfort one another, agree with one another, live in peace; and the God of love and peace will be with you.
So then let us pursue what makes for peace and for mutual upbuilding.
“Behold, God is my salvation; I will trust, and will not be afraid; for the Lord God is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation.”
But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, open to reason, full of mercy and good fruits, impartial and sincere.
Eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
May mercy, peace, and love be multiplied to you.
Let me hear what God the Lord will speak, for he will speak peace to his people, to his saints; but let them not turn back to folly.
“Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace among those with whom he is pleased!”
The Lord bless you and keep you; the Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.
The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
But he was pierced for our transgressions; he was crushed for our iniquities; upon him was the chastisement that brought us peace, and with his wounds we are healed.
For the moment all discipline seems painful rather than pleasant, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
And the effect of righteousness will be peace, and the result of righteousness, quietness and trust forever.
Now may the God of peace himself sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking but of righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife, but every fool will be quarreling.
Whoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
Bearing with one another and, if one has a complaint against another, forgiving each other; as the Lord has forgiven you, so you also must forgive.
See that no one repays anyone evil for evil, but always seek to do good to one another and to everyone.
Mark the blameless and behold the upright, for there is a future for the man of peace.
Fear not, for I am with you; be not dismayed, for I am your God; I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
O Lord, you will ordain peace for us, for you have indeed done for us all our works.
“Agree with God, and be at peace; thereby good will come to you.
May the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
Repay no one evil for evil, but give thought to do what is honorable in the sight of all.
So flee youthful passions and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace, along with those who call on the Lord from a pure heart.
All your children shall be taught by the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children.
The Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.
Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, how will you make it salty again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”
To give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
My son, do not forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commandments, for length of days and years of life and peace they will add to you.
Better is a dry morsel with quiet than a house full of feasting with strife.
My people will abide in a peaceful habitation, in secure dwellings, and in quiet resting places.
Behold, I will bring to it health and healing, and I will heal them and reveal to them abundance of prosperity and security.
For he himself is our peace, who has made us both one and has broken down in his flesh the dividing wall of hostility
To all those in Rome who are loved by God and called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
“There is no peace,” says the Lord, “for the wicked.”
Steadfast love and faithfulness meet; righteousness and peace kiss each other.
There is no peace,” says my God, “for the wicked.”
For God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
My covenant with him was one of life and peace, and I gave them to him. It was a covenant of fear, and he feared me. He stood in awe of my name.
The Lord make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up his countenance upon you and give you peace.
Rejoice in hope, be patient in tribulation, be constant in prayer.
Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, rejoice.
Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds,
You make known to me the path of life; in your presence there is fullness of joy; at your right hand are pleasures forevermore.
Until now you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full.
A joyful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
So also you have sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.
These things I have spoken to you, that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be full.
For his anger is but for a moment, and his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may tarry for the night, but joy comes with the morning.
This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.
Though you have not seen him, you love him. Though you do not now see him, you believe in him and rejoice with joy that is inexpressible and filled with glory,
You have put more joy in my heart than they have when their grain and wine abound.
The hope of the righteous brings joy, but the expectation of the wicked will perish.
My lips will shout for joy, when I sing praises to you; my soul also, which you have redeemed.
Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep.
Just so, I tell you, there is joy before the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
But let all who take refuge in you rejoice; let them ever sing for joy, and spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may exult in you.
Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds, for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my whole being rejoices; my flesh also dwells secure.
When the cares of my heart are many, your consolations cheer my soul.
Rejoice always,
Go, eat your bread with joy, and drink your wine with a merry heart, for God has already approved what you do.
Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and joy are in his place.
And now my head shall be lifted up above my enemies all around me, and I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing and make melody to the Lord.
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, O righteous, and shout for joy, all you upright in heart!
Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.
Those who sow in tears shall reap with shouts of joy!
The Lord is my strength and my shield; in him my heart trusts, and I am helped; my heart exults, and with my song I give thanks to him.
Rejoice always, pray without ceasing, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.
You have turned for me my mourning into dancing; you have loosed my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness,
Though I have much to write to you, I would rather not use paper and ink. Instead I hope to come to you and talk face to face, so that our joy may be complete.
Restore to me the joy of your salvation, and uphold me with a willing spirit.
Your testimonies are my heritage forever, for they are the joy of my heart.
And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, for you received the word in much affliction, with the joy of the Holy Spirit,
For our heart is glad in him, because we trust in his holy name.
I am acting with great boldness toward you; I have great pride in you; I am filled with comfort. In all our affliction, I am overflowing with joy.
But rejoice insofar as you share Christ's sufferings, that you may also rejoice and be glad when his glory is revealed.
The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart; the commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes;
So that by God's will I may come to you with joy and be refreshed in your company.
And we are writing these things so that our joy may be complete.
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah. Clap your hands, all peoples! Shout to God with loud songs of joy!
A Psalm for giving thanks. Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth!
The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice; he who fathers a wise son will be glad in him.
For you are our glory and joy.
Your words were found, and I ate them, and your words became to me a joy and the delight of my heart, for I am called by your name, O Lord, God of hosts.
For the sake of Christ, then, I am content with weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and calamities. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
But now I am coming to you, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy fulfilled in themselves.
You have multiplied the nation; you have increased its joy; they rejoice before you as with joy at the harvest, as they are glad when they divide the spoil.
Being strengthened with all power, according to his glorious might, for all endurance and patience with joy;
For I have derived much joy and comfort from your love, my brother, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you.
I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth.
Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.
Shout, and sing for joy, O inhabitant of Zion, for great in your midst is the Holy One of Israel.”
His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a little; I will set you over much. Enter into the joy of your master.’
And the angel said to them, “Fear not, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy that will be for all the people.
In the way of your testimonies I delight as much as in all riches.
Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones that you have broken rejoice.
As sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, yet possessing everything.
You have made known to me the paths of life; you will make me full of gladness with your presence.’
And my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,
Delight yourself in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart.
For what thanksgiving can we return to God for you, for all the joy that we feel for your sake before our God,
More than that, we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.
And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
When they saw the star, they rejoiced exceedingly with great joy.
For you make him most blessed forever; you make him glad with the joy of your presence.
With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.
May all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you! May those who love your salvation say evermore, “God is great!”
So he brought his people out with joy, his chosen ones with singing.
And they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
For the Lord takes pleasure in his people; he adorns the humble with salvation.

And God is able to make all grace abound to you, so that having all sufficiency in all things at all times, you may abound in every good work.
When I am afraid, I put my trust in you.

O Lord, all my longing is before you; my sighing is not hidden from you.

For in much wisdom is much vexation, and he who increases knowledge increases sorrow.
I sought the Lord, and he answered me and delivered me from all my fears.
So we can confidently say, “The Lord is my helper; I will not fear; what can man do to me?”

For I know that my Redeemer lives, and at the last he will stand upon the earth.

And God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.

And he said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat, nor about your body, what you will put on.
“Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord, whose trust is the Lord.

Nothing is covered up that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known.
And great crowds gathered about him, so that he got into a boat and sat down. And the whole crowd stood on the beach.

Not domineering over those in your charge, but being examples to the flock.

Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

The Lord is my strength and my song, and he has become my salvation; this is my God, and I will praise him, my father's God, and I will exalt him.
God, the Lord, is my strength; he makes my feet like the deer's; he makes me tread on my high places. To the choirmaster: with stringed instruments.

‘Ah, Lord God! It is you who have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm! Nothing is too hard for you.
Of David. The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all you who wait for the Lord!
But I will sing of your strength; I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For you have been to me a fortress and a refuge in the day of my distress.
Then he said to me, “This is the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel: Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit, says the Lord of hosts.

To the choirmaster. Of the Sons of Korah. According to Alamoth. A Song. God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
The Lord is my strength and my song; he has become my salvation.
For who is God, but the Lord? And who is a rock, except our God?—
The God who equipped me with strength and made my way blameless.
For the word of the cross is folly to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
For not by their own sword did they win the land, nor did their own arm save them, but your right hand and your arm, and the light of your face, for you delighted in them.
My soul melts away for sorrow; strengthen me according to your word!
That according to the riches of his glory he may grant you to be strengthened with power through his Spirit in your inner being,
On the day I called, you answered me; my strength of soul you increased.
For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily, and you have been filled in him, who is the head of all rule and authority.
To another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by the one Spirit,
The name of the Lord is a strong tower; the righteous man runs into it and is safe.
For thus said the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, “In returning and rest you shall be saved; in quietness and in trust shall be your strength.” But you were unwilling,

But you, O Lord, do not be far off! O you my help, come quickly to my aid!

The Almighty—we cannot find him; he is great in power; justice and abundant righteousness he will not violate.

“You have led in your steadfast love the people whom you have redeemed; you have guided them by your strength to your holy abode.

Children, obey your parents in everything, for this pleases the Lord.

My son, keep your father's commandment, and forsake not your mother's teaching.
He must manage his own household well, with all dignity keeping his children submissive,
Whoever troubles his own household will inherit the wind, and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
A wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish man despises his mother.

The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother.

For whatever was written in former days was written for our instruction, that through endurance and through the encouragement of the Scriptures we might have hope.

But if we hope for what we do not see, we wait for it with patience.

You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.

Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
I wait for the Lord, my soul waits, and in his word I hope;
Let your steadfast love, O Lord, be upon us, even as we hope in you.
For you, O Lord, are my hope, my trust, O Lord, from my youth.
For in this hope we were saved. Now hope that is seen is not hope. For who hopes for what he sees?

We have this as a sure and steadfast anchor of the soul, a hope that enters into the inner place behind the curtain,
Waiting for our blessed hope, the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,
For through the Spirit, by faith, we ourselves eagerly wait for the hope of righteousness.

In hope of eternal life, which God, who never lies, promised before the ages began
